page.title: 16HISTON & IMPINGTON
page.content: IN 1895,CHIVER'S CHIMNEY WAS BEING KNOCKED DOWN WHEN 700 PEOPLE AND THE PRESS TURNED UP.IN THE SUMMER,THE FAIR GOES TO HISTON BROOK,AND THE FEAST STARTS ON 7th JULY WITH FLOATS. {b)IMPINGTON VILLAGE COLLEG:}OVER 1000 CHILDREN GO TO{I.V.C.}THEY COME FROM THE NEIGBOURING VILLAGES AND CAM- BRIDGE.IT IS 11-18 COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL WITH SIXTH FORMS.CHILDREN ARE ORGANISED IN SETS IN EACH YEAR GROUP FOR DIFFERENT SUBJECTS.STUDENTS WEAR UNIFORM.THERE ARE MANY CLUBS AT LUNCH TIMES,NAMELY,HOCKEY,RUGBY, ROUNDERS, ETC.SOME OTHER CLUBS OPERATE AFTER SCHOOL.DURING THE EVENING THERE ARE MANY ADULT CLASSES AND A YOUTH CLUB, WHICH IS POPULAR,WITH PROVISIONS FOR SWIMMING,DISCO,ELECTRONIC AND TELE- VISION GAMES IN ITS OWN SEPERATE BUILDING.THEY FULFIL THE PHILOSOPHY OF {HENRY MORRIS,}A FORMER CHIEF EDUCATION
